column1: Jack is in the kitchen in his house. Jack wants a cold drink from the refrigerator. The refrigerator is full of fresh food. Jack thinks the refrigerator is full of fresh food. Suddenly, a power cut changes the state of the food in the refrigerator to spoiled. Jack doesn't notice the power cut.
column2: Does Jack think the food in the refrigerator is fresh or spoiled?
column3: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is fresh.
column4: Jack thinks the food in the refrigerator is spoiled.

column1: Caden is in his new house. Caden wants to fix all the things that are not right. There is a big leak in the roof. Caden thinks there is a big leak in the roof. Suddenly, the sun comes out and dries up the leak. Caden doesn't see the sun dry up the leak.
column2: Does Caden think there is a leak in the roof or has the sun dried it up?
column3: Caden thinks there is still a leak in the roof.
column4: Caden thinks the sun has dried up the leak.

column1: Vivi is in her room playing with her toys. Vivi wants to lay her small, patient triangle toy on the shelf with her other toys. The triangle toy is in her toy box. Vivi believes the triangle toy is in her toy box. Suddenly, her baby brother crawls into the room and takes the triangle toy. Vivi doesn't see her baby brother take the triangle toy.
column2: Does Vivi believe the triangle toy is in her toy box or that her baby brother has taken it?
column3: Vivi believes the triangle toy is in her toy box.
column4: Vivi believes her baby brother has taken the triangle toy.

column1: Emma is in her room after a long day at school. Emma wants to draw on her white bathrobe to make it look creative. The bathrobe is plain and white. Emma believes the bathrobe is plain and white. Suddenly, a spill from a bottle of bleach changes the bathrobe from white to a patchy white and yellow. Emma doesn't see the bleach spill.
column2: Does Emma think the bathrobe is plain white or patchy white and yellow?
column3: Emma thinks the bathrobe is plain white.
column4: Emma thinks the bathrobe is patchy white and yellow.

column1: Ollie is at the beach building a sand castle. Ollie wants to dig a deep hole with his spade. The spade is sharp and safe to use. Ollie thinks the spade is sharp and safe to use. All of a sudden, a wave from the sea splashes on the spade making it slippery and dangerous. Ollie doesn't see the wave splash on the spade.
column2: Does Ollie think the spade is safe or dangerous?
column3: Ollie thinks the spade is safe.
column4: Ollie thinks the spade is dangerous.

column1: Ben is at the train station. Ben wants to catch the train to go to work. The train is on time. Ben believes the train is on time. Suddenly, a signal fault delays the train and makes it late. Ben does not see the signal fault.
column2: Does Ben think the train is on time or late?
column3: Ben believes the train is on time.
column4: Ben believes the train is late.

column1: Pia is at her school library. Pia wants to read a mystery book. The mystery book is on the top shelf. Pia thinks the mystery book is on the top shelf. Suddenly, a tall boy moves the mystery book to the bottom shelf. Pia doesn't see the tall boy move the book.
column2: Does Pia think the mystery book is on the top shelf or the bottom shelf?
column3: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the top shelf.
column4: Pia thinks the mystery book is on the bottom shelf.

column1: Chloe is at a fair in her town. Chloe wants to hug the fireman at the fair. The fireman is very friendly. Chloe thinks the fireman is very friendly. Suddenly, a loud noise scares the fireman and he becomes very scared. Chloe doesn't hear the loud noise.
column2: Does Chloe think the fireman is friendly or scared?
column3: Chloe thinks the fireman is friendly.
column4: Chloe thinks the fireman is scared.

column1: Wendy is at a yard sale in her town. Wendy wants to buy a beautiful bracelet she saw. The bracelet is shiny and cheap. Wendy believes the bracelet is shiny and cheap. Suddenly, a famous collector recognizes the bracelet and its value increases to an expensive price. Wendy does not hear the famous collector talking about the bracelet.
column2: Does Wendy think the bracelet is cheap or expensive?
column3: Wendy thinks the bracelet is cheap.
column4: Wendy thinks the bracelet is expensive.

column1: Yara is in her room with her favorite teddy bear, Stitch. Yara wants to hide Stitch so her little brother cannot find him. Stitch smells like yummy vanilla because Yara sprayed him with her vanilla perfume. Yara believes Stitch smells like yummy vanilla. Suddenly, a spilt bottle of vinegar changes the scent of Stitch to sour. Yara does not perceive the vinegar spill.
column2: Does Yara believe Stitch smells like yummy vanilla or sour vinegar?
column3: Yara believes Stitch smells like yummy vanilla.
column4: Yara believes Stitch smells like sour vinegar.

column1: Nia is in her home, ready to bake a cake. Nia wants to bake a cake in the oven. The oven is in good working order. Nia believes the oven is in good working order. Suddenly, a small earthquake shakes the house and the oven breaks. Nia does not realize the oven is broken.
column2: Does Nia think the oven is in good working order or broken?
column3: Nia believes the oven is in good working order.
column4: Nia believes the oven is broken.

column1: Amy is walking in the park. Amy wants to sit on a bench and rest. The bench is covered with pretty vines. Amy believes the bench is covered with pretty vines. Suddenly, a gardener sprays the vines with a substance that changes them from non-harmful to harmful. Amy does not see the gardener spraying the vines.
column2: Does Amy believe the bench is covered with non-harmful or harmful vines?
column3: Amy believes the bench is covered with non-harmful vines.
column4: Amy believes the bench is covered with harmful vines.

column1: Kate is in the park with her old toy car. Kate wants to drive the toy car on the clean cloth she brought. The cloth is clean and spread on the grass. Kate believes the cloth is clean and ready for her toy car. Suddenly, a dog runs across the park and makes the cloth dirty with its muddy paws. Kate does not see the dog run across the cloth.
column2: Does Kate think the cloth is clean or dirty?
column3: Kate believes the cloth is clean.
column4: Kate believes the cloth is dirty.

column1: Ella is at the park with her parent. Ella wants to complete her ice cream before it melts. The ice cream has a sweet taste. Ella believes her ice cream has a sweet taste. Suddenly, a gust of wind blows some sand onto the ice cream, changing its taste to gritty. Ella doesn't notice the sand in her ice cream.
column2: Does Ella think her ice cream is sweet or gritty?
column3: Ella thinks her ice cream is sweet.
column4: Ella thinks her ice cream is gritty.

column1: Uma is in her room with a big clock on the wall. Uma wants to move the clock to another room. The clock is brown. Uma believes the clock is brown. Suddenly, a splash of paint from a passing parade changes the color of the clock to rainbow. Uma doesn't see the splash of paint.
column2: Does Uma think the clock is brown or rainbow?
column3: Uma believes the clock is brown.
column4: Uma believes the clock is rainbow.
